metadata.title: CVE-2016-6855 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Eye of GNOME (aka eog) 3.16.5, 3.17.x, 3.18.x before 3.18.3, 3.19.x, and3.20.x before 3.20.4, when used with glib before 2.44.1, allow remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write and crash) viavectors involving passing invalid UTF-8 to GMarkup.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6855` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

eog - 3.18.2-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: eog package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.18.2-1ubuntu2.1').
